attributes.action: Keep Disability Benefits, and reverse U-turn from manifesto pledge.
attributes.additional_details: By turning back on the manifesto promise of no cuts to disability benefits, what the government will  do is harm disabled people, who are an already vulnerable group, history has shown this, and negatively affect  their growth targets as cuts to benefits means less money to spend and people spending less harms growth.
attributes.background: The U- turn on the manifesto pledge to not cut disability benefits is wrong, parliament must think  again and keep disability benefits and not cut them.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions, which call for similar action:

Protect Disabled people who cannot work from planned cuts to benefits
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/721547

Stop PIP Cuts: Protect Support for Disabled People
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/721918
